bibl.title: Louis Brown v. J.C. Mitchell and James Bogant. Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court for the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory

body.p: IN THE DISTRICT COURT,
Of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding Terms at Seattle, for the County of King.
HABEAS CORPUS.
The People of the United States of America, to the J.C. Mitchell + James Bogant Chief of Police and Jailor Sheriff of King County Greetings:

We command you, that you have the body of Louis Brown by you imprisoned and detained as it is said, together with the time and cause of such imprisonment and detention, by whatsoever name said Louis Brown shall be called or charged, before the HON. Richard A. Jones Charles E. Boyle, Judge of aforesaid Court at chambers inthe court house in the city of Seattle, at the hour of three o'clock P.M. this date to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning him the said Louis Brown
And have you then and there this writ.
WITNESS THE HON. RICHARD A JONES Charles E. Boyle, Judge of said District Court, and the seal thereof this 22nd day of Nov. A.D. 1888
W.E. Ledgerwood Clerk.
Directory of Washington } ss. County of King

I hereby certify that I received the within writ on the 22nd day of Nov. 1888, and pursuant to the order of said Court I herewith bring into court the body of the within issued Louis Brown. I here then certify that shall the said defendant by virtue of a commitment duly issued by N. Soderberg a Justice of the Peace in the City of Seattle commanding the the said Louis Brown to safely keep in the city jail of said city, a copy of the said commitment attached hereto
J.C. Mitchell Chief of Police
In the District Court, Third Judicial District, Holding Terms at Seattle, W.T.
In the matter of the Application of Louis Brown For Writ of Habeas Corpus
HABEAS CORPUS.
IN THE DISTRICT COURT,
Of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding Terms at Seattle, for the County of King.
HABEAS CORPUS.
The people of the United States of America to the Sheriff J.C. Mitchell + James Bogant Chief of Police + Jailor of King County Greeting:

We commad you, that you have the body of Louis Brown by you imprisoned and detained as it is said, together with the time and cause of such imprisonment and detention, by whatsoever name said Louis Brown shall be called or charged before the HON ROGER S. GREENE Charles E. Boyle, Judge of the aforesaid Court at chambers in the Court house in the city of Seattle at the hour of three o'clockP.M. this date to do and receive what shall then are there be considered concerning the said Louis Brown And have you then and there this writ.
WITNESS THE HON. Roger S. Greene Charles E. Boyle, Judge of the said District Court, and the seal thereof this 22nd day of Nov, A.D. 1888
W.E. Ledgerwood, Clerk
In the matter of the application of Louis Brown for Writ of Habeas Corpus
Habeas Corpus
